result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon R Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond previously posted in the amount of $100.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon R Simmons

records.addlTxt: Warrant cancelled with WCSD-Case sent to SDC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 11:45 AM: Defendant Dillon R Simmons in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel confirm recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/o Repeater:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Repeater component dismissed attached to the charge.  Statement by Def: None offered.   The Court:  Accepts resolution.  30 days WCJ I/S (GT and Huber if revoked) - No TS credit.  S/W 1 yr probation  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs - Bond to Apply - 60 DTP or PP.  May petition for early termination after completion of 6 mos, if joined by Supervising Agent.  DNA sample to be provided.  Procedure for expungement explained thru DOJ.  Counsel and Court Officer confirm DNA previously provided thru another felony conviction.  Appeal Rights Given.

ADDRESS INFO for Dillon R Simmons
Current: 567 Broadway St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 7203 County Road K, Omro, WI 54963

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 11:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:00 PM: Defendant Dillon R Simmons in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - currently not employed.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility process.  Def to speak with SPD today.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
